topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54decd4863687226fddd1e00#post_54decd4863687226fddd1e00
It's kind of old news really, but basically there's a increasing number of women who model as men and men who model as women.


Yo; crazy thought here, but is it just me or are gender roles flipping?  Getting past all the "femnazis are feminizing men" bullshit you hear about they do kind of have a point; if you look at fashion and how people in photos look there has been a considerable change.  A hundred years ago, which is a short fucking time history wise, women had to wear dresses and god forbid they show any ankle; men had to wear pants and shit.

I'm obviously not agreeing with the nutters, but rather the norm seems to be shifting in the opposite direction in the west.  Obviously a lot of men like being ultra masculine and a lot of women like being ultra feminine, but rather my point is that in say fifty years I would not be surprised if it was the norm for men to wear shirts, dresses, wear makeup and for women to wear. . . well shit man I don't even know cause I've met some pretty masculine women before.
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54decde363687279f23c0000#post_54decde363687279f23c0000
[bq="SquiggyBomb"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54decd2263687233dbe50500#post_54decd2263687233dbe50500
How long till Tumblr gets super butthurt about "Men invading female territory"[/bq]
It's already happened.

topics.body:
"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54decfbf63687268882c0700#post_54decfbf63687268882c0700
I personally disagree; there will always be some sort of gender barrier, but rather than how in the past you would get shot for breaking them rather they will become gender roles people are comfortable with.

I don't mean as in we'll have people with rainbow hair wearing skirts, high heels and sweater vests and tophats as the norm with one side of their face shaved with makeup applied and the other side with a beard, but rather people over time coming to not give a fuck for the percentage of people outside traditional gender roles.

Less of a:
"FREEDOM!"
And more of a:
"Did you see that guy wearing high heels?  Those definitely don't match his suit"
